com.exacttarget.etpushsdk

Class ETPush

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.exacttarget.etpushsdk.ETPush
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RegistrationEventListener

    public class ETPush
extends Object
implements RegistrationEventListener
    JB4A SDK main support class.

      • pushManager

        public static ETPush pushManager()
                          throws ETException
        Primary accessor for the ETPush singleton. All Push interactions with ExactTarget should take place through this method. Before using this method, you must first call readyAimFire(Context, String, String, String, boolean, boolean, boolean) from your Application's Application.onCreate() method.
        Returns:
        ETPush singleton pushManager
        Throws:
        ETException

      • initiateLatch

        protected static void initiateLatch(long latchTimeout)
                             throws ETException
        We need to wait for readyAimFire() to finish initializing before allowing other methods to execute.
        Parameters:
        latchTimeout - The amount of time to wait in milliseconds
        Throws:
        ETException

      • readyAimFire

        public static void readyAimFire(Context applicationContext,
                String etAppId,
                String accessToken,
                String gcmSenderId,
                boolean enableETanalytics,
                boolean enableLocationManager,
                boolean enableCloudPages)
                         throws ETException
        Call this from your Application's Application.onCreate() method. This initializes ETPush.

        Configures the SDK to point to the correct Code@ application.

        These credentials are provided by Code@ExactTarget, and are generated there. Best practice is to create two applications, one for a dev instance, and one for prod.

        Parameters:
        applicationContext - Must be an application context. Do not send Activity context.
        etAppId - Generated application ID to identify with ExactTarget
        accessToken - Generated token to allow access to the Fuel API
        enableETanalytics - true to activate Salesforce Marketing Cloud Analytics. You must have use activityResumed() and activityPaused() from ETPush in each of your activities onPause() and onResume() methods
        enableLocationManager - true if the location manager or geofencing will be used
        enableCloudPages - true if CloudPage Inbox will be used
        Throws:
        ETException

      • readyAimFire

        public static void readyAimFire(Context applicationContext,
                String etAppId,
                String accessToken,
                String gcmSenderId,
                boolean enableETanalytics,
                boolean enablePIanalytics,
                boolean enableLocationManager,
                boolean enableCloudPages)
                         throws ETException
        Call this from your Application's Application.onCreate() method. This initializes ETPush. This method allows you to also add Web and Mobile Analytics to your app. See Code@ doc for more info.

        Configures the SDK to point to the correct Code@ application.

        These credentials are provided by Code@ExactTarget, and are generated there. Best practice is to create two applications, one for a dev instance, and one for prod.

        Parameters:
        applicationContext - Must be an application context. Do not send Activity context.
        etAppId - Generated application ID to identify with ExactTarget
        accessToken - Generated token to allow access to the Fuel API
        enableETanalytics - true to activate Salesforce Marketing Cloud Analytics. You must have use activityResumed() and activityPaused() from ETPush in each of your activities onPause() and onResume() methods
        enablePIanalytics - true to activate Web and Mobile Analytics. You must have use activityResumed() and activityPaused() from ETPush in each of your activities onPause() and onResume() methods
        enableLocationManager - true if the location manager or geofencing will be used
        enableCloudPages - true if CloudPage Inbox will be used
        Throws:
        ETException

        protected static boolean checkActivityExistsInManifest(Context applicationContext,
                                    Class<?> cls)

      • registerForRemoteNotifications

        protected void registerForRemoteNotifications(boolean forceRegistration)
                                       throws ETException
        Wrapper method that begins the registration flow with Google/GCM or Amazon/ADM.

        Parameters:
        forceRegistration - allow for the forced re-registration to refresh the device token. Implemented while adding the PACKAGE_REPLACED receiver.
        Throws:
        ETException

      • isPushEnabled

        public boolean isPushEnabled()
        Checks persistent preferences for the state of Push. Push is enabled by either enablePush() or disablePush()
        Returns:
        boolean The state of push, either on or off, as managed by the Push Manager.

      • enablePush

        public void enablePush()
                throws ETException
        Enables push and push accessories in the SDK.

        This method should be called when explicit permission for Push has been given by the user. No interface for this is provided. By comparison, iOS will prompt the user when an app wants to send Push notifications. As Android doesn't, you must do so on your own.

        Throws:
        ETException
        See Also:
        disablePush()

      • thirdPartyPushServicesAvailable

        protected boolean thirdPartyPushServicesAvailable()
                                           throws ETException
        Checks required 3rd party services for push notifications

        If googleplayservices library is outdated, a notification is displayed to prompt the user to install it.

        Returns:
        true if the necessary 3rd party libraries are installed
        Throws:
        ETException
        See Also:
        #disablePush()

      • disablePush

        public void disablePush()
                 throws ETException
        Disables push and push accessories in the SDK.

        This method should be called if the user decided they no longer wish to receive Push notifications. To be compliant, you need to provide the user with means to disable Push. If googleplayservices library is outdated, a notification is displayed to prompt the user to install it.

        Throws:
        ETException
        See Also:
        enablePush()

      • setNotificationRecipientClass

        public void setNotificationRecipientClass(Class<?> cls)
                                   throws ETException
        The Activity that should be activated when a notification is acted upon. If unspecified, default behavior is to launch the application's Launcher activity.
        Parameters:
        cls - Reference to the Activity you wish to launch.
        Throws:
        ETException

      • setNotificationResourceId

        public void setNotificationResourceId(Integer notificationResourceId)
                               throws ETException
        Each notification requires an icon to meet the specs provided by Google. Android 5.0 enforces those standards. http://developer.android.com/design/style/iconography.html#notification
        Parameters:
        notificationResourceId - Resource id of the icon to use for the notification
        Throws:
        ETException

      • getNotificationResourceId

        public Integer getNotificationResourceId()
        Getter for the notification icon. Used internally.
        Returns:
        Resource id of the icon to use for the notification

      • addAttribute

        public void addAttribute(String attribute,
                String value)
                  throws ETException
        Adds an attribute to current user's Contact model.

        This data is available in MobilePush, and will automatically map to any matching attribute within MobilePush/Contacts.

        Note that attribute mapping is case sensitive, and spaces should be avoided.

        Parameters:
        attribute - Attribute name
        value - Value to assign to that attribute for this user
        Throws:
        ETException

      • removeAttribute

        public void removeAttribute(String attribute)
                     throws ETException
        Removes an attribute from the current user's data, and prevents it from being sent to ExactTarget. This will also cause that attribute to be cleared in Contacts.

        Note that attribute mapping is case sensitive, and spaces should be avoided.

        Parameters:
        attribute - Name of the attribute to remove.
        Throws:
        ETException

      • getAttributes

        public ArrayList<Attribute> getAttributes()
                                   throws ETException
        Gets the list of attributes from the current user's data.
        Throws:
        ETException

      • addTag

        public void addTag(String tag)
            throws ETException
        Adds a tag to the current user's Contact model.

        This data will be available through MobilePush for use of creation of an audience.

        Parameters:
        tag - Name of the tag to be set
        Throws:
        ETException

      • registerDeviceToken

        protected void registerDeviceToken(String deviceToken)
                            throws ETException
        Returns the device's platform-specific token to ExactTarget. This method should only be called internally by ET_GenericReceiver.onReceive(Context, android.content.Intent).
        Parameters:
        deviceToken - Platform-specific device token provided by Google/GCM or Amazon/ADM.
        Throws:
        ETException

      • getDeviceToken

        public String getDeviceToken()
                      throws ETException
        Returns the currently set device token for the registered device. If
        Returns:
        the device token, or empty string if the device is unregistered.
        Throws:
        ETException

      • unregisterDeviceToken

                              throws ETException

      • getOpenDirectRecipient

        Returns:
        the openDirectRecipient

      • setOpenDirectRecipient

        public void setOpenDirectRecipient(Class<?> openDirectRecipient)
                            throws ETException
        Sets the class that should receive the OpenDirect message. It will be delivered a bundle with string extra "_od" included. If not set, the system will default to using ETLandingPagePresenter to handle OpenDirect messages.
        Parameters:
        openDirectRecipient - the openDirectRecipient to set
        Throws:
        ETException

      • getCloudPageRecipient

        public Class<?> getCloudPageRecipient()
        Returns a pointer to the CloudPage recipient class.
        Returns:
        the cloudPageRecipient

      • setCloudPageRecipient

        public void setCloudPageRecipient(Class<?> cloudPageRecipient)
                           throws ETException
        Sets the class that should receive the CloudPage message. It will be delivered a bundle with string extra "_x" included. If not set, the system will default to using ETLandingPagePresenter to handle CloudPage messages.
        Parameters:
        cloudPageRecipient - the cloudPageRecipient to set
        Throws:
        ETException

      • getNotificationAction

        protected String getNotificationAction()

      • setNotificationAction

        public void setNotificationAction(String notificationAction)
        Sets the action parameter of the intent to be fired when a notification is received. For example, you might pass something like Intent.ACTION_VIEW. You must also call setNotificationActionUri(Uri) to launch a notification intent using this method.
        Parameters:
        notificationAction -

      • getNotificationActionUri

        protected Uri getNotificationActionUri()

      • setNotificationActionUri

        public void setNotificationActionUri(Uri notificationActionUri)
        Sets the Intent data URI to use when a notification is clicked. You must also call setNotificationAction(String) to launch a notification intent using this method.
        Parameters:
        notificationActionUri -
